items.title: Match of the Day
items.summary: Highlights of six Premier League games, including Arsenal v Aston Villa.

items.title: Was VAR right to give Chelsea a penalty vs. Bournemouth?
items.summary: Was VAR right to intervene after Est√™v√£o was bundled over by Semenyo in the penalty area?

items.title: Rangers vindt weer aansluiting in Schotland
items.summary: Dinsdag gaat het weer los in de Premier League. Koploper Arsenal ontvangt Aston Villa, dat zich lijkt te gaan mengen in de titelstrijd, en Manchester United neemt het op tegen hekkensluiter Wolverhampton Wanderers. Op de Afrika Cup zijn vier potjes, en in Schotland zetten Celtic en Rangers hun achtervolging op koploper Heart of Midlothian voort. Volg het belangrijkste voetbal van dinsdag in deze VI Live.

items.title: England group warns FIFA: WC fans priced out
items.summary: A fans' group says "alarm bells should be ringing" at FIFA with England's fans having failed to take up their full ticket allocation for next summer's World Cup final.

items.title: Arsenal run riot in win over Villa to pad lead in 1st
items.summary: Arsenal scored four times in a rampant second-half display to secure a statement 4-1 win over Premier League title rivals Aston Villa at the Emirates.

items.title: Maresca under fire again after Chelsea draw
items.summary: Chelsea's poor Premier League form extended to one win in seven games as Bournemouth held on for a 2-2 draw at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: Arsenal's Arteta: Rice knee injury only short term
items.summary: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has said Declan Rice's knee injury is a short-term issue, although it means he miss Tuesday's top-of-the-table clash with Aston Villa.

items.title: Amorim legt 'vreemde' Zirkzee-wissel uit na Man United-sof
items.summary: R√∫ben Amorim baalt dat hij het jaar 2025 niet met een goed gevoel af heeft kunnen sluiten . Manchester United beet zich stuk op hekkensluiter Wolverhampton Wanderers, dat pas het derde punt van het seizoen pakte op Old Trafford. Ook ging Amorim in op de wissel van Joshua Zirkzee.

items.title: Dundee United climb back into top six with victory at Livingston
items.summary: Dundee United moved back into the Scottish Premiership top six with a deserved 3-1 win at basement side Livingston.

items.title: Bournemouth draw with Chelsea after chaotic first half
items.summary: Bournemouth are winless against Chelsea in their last nine Premier League matches after drawing 2-2 at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: Wolves earn shock draw at Man Utd to end losing run
items.summary: Ladislav Krejci equaliser earns Wolverhampton Wanderers their first point since October as they draw 1-1 at Manchester United.

items.title: Arsenal score four second-half goals to thrash Villa
items.summary: Arsenal score four second-half goals to beat Aston Villa 4-1 and end the year five points clear at the top of the Premier League table.

items.title: Dundee secure comeback victory over Kilmarnock
items.summary: Dundee came from behind to secure a precious 2-1 victory over Kilmarnock at Dens Park.

items.title: Hibs follow up derby glory by easing past Aberdeen
items.summary: Thibault Klidje and Junior Hoilett struck in the second half as Hibernian backed up their Edinburgh derby triumph with a 2-0 home win over listless Aberdeen.

items.title: Brighton come from behind twice to draw with West Ham
items.summary: Brighton & Hove Albion come back from behind twice to draw 2-2 with West Ham United in a match that saw three penalties awarded in the first half.

items.title: Alleen op papier een topper: Arsenal vermorzelt Aston Villa
items.summary: Arsenal heeft zijn status als titelkandidaat andermaal bevestigd. In de topper tegen Aston Villa was de ploeg van Mikel Arteta heer en meester: 4-1.

items.title: Gabriel Magalh√£es‚Äô opener sparks Arsenal‚Äôs second-half rout of Aston Villa
items.summary: Arsenal will enter 2026 with a five-point lead at the top of the Premier League as they continue their quest for the club‚Äôs very own holy grail, and judging by this game of two halves against putative title rivals they may need it. A scrappy, angst-ridden opening 45 minutes was followed by a performance of complete dominance kickstarted by two goals in the space of five minutes from Gabriel Magalh√£es and Mart√≠n Zubimendi at the start of the second half. Leandro Trossard added a third with 20 minutes left before the substitute Gabriel Jesus rubbed salt in Aston Villa‚Äôs wounds to compound their first defeat in 12 matches and leave them six points adrift of the leaders in third. Continue reading...

items.title: Krejci grabs point for Wolves as Manchester United continue to flounder
items.summary: Manchester United missed eight frontline players so Wolves, who arrived as the Premier League‚Äôs bottom team with only two points, seemed ideal opponents. Yet Ruben Amorim‚Äôs side struggled ‚Äì badly ‚Äì and while Bruno Fernandes, Bryan Mbeumo and Harry Maguire headed those unavailable, the display still provokes questions regarding United‚Äôs cohesion. In the contest‚Äôs closing phase they were potent only sporadically ‚Äì as throughout. Their opening-half strike was a fortunate Joshua Zirkzee finish ‚Äì it rebounded in off Ladislav Krejci. Continue reading...

items.title: Scorende Zirkzee kan pijnlijke misstap Man Utd niet voorkomen
items.summary: Intro

items.title: Guimar√£es shuts down Burnley‚Äôs late fightback to end Newcastle‚Äôs poor away run
items.summary: It is, ultimately, only the result that matters in football. Newcastle almost stopped playing after going two goals ahead inside seven minutes and spent the remainder of the game desperately holding on for their second away win of the season, leaving Burnley wondering what more they could have done. Burnley were dominant in all areas after the early shock, showing the spirit and grit required in a relegation battle, but the truth of the matter is they have two points from the last possible 30 and are facing an immediate return to the Championship. Josh Laurent ignited hope when there was none after Joelinton and Yoane Wissa scored, a flame that was finally put out by Bruno Guimar√£es late on. Continue reading...
